components module¶

Contains a number of functions used in derivative modules relating to the internal functionality of the game.

components.await_exit() → None¶

Waits for the user to close the program, usually after a critical error has occured.

components.check_square(board: list[list[int]], square: tuple[int, int], size: [<class 'int'>]) → bool¶

Checks if a square is within the board.

components.create_battleships(filename: str = 'battleships.txt') → dict[str, int]¶

Reads a file and copies the data into an array.

Parameters:

filename (str) – The name of the file to be accessed.

Returns:

A dictionary with the ship name as the key and the length as the value.

Return type:

dict

components.get_default_ships() → dict[str, int]¶
components.get_json_data(filename: str) → dict¶

Reads a JSON file and returns the data for later use.

Parameters:

filename (str) – The name of the file to be accessed, with the extension intact.

Return data:

The data contained in the JSON file in dictionary format.

components.initialise_board(size: int = 10) → list[list[str]]¶

Generates the board given a board size.

Parameters:

size (int (should be > 0)) – The size of the board.

Returns:

The board as a list of n lists of size n.

Return type:

list

components.place_battleships(board: list[list[str]], ships: dict[str, int], algorithm='simple') → list[list[str]]¶

Populates a board with battleships

Parameters:

  • board (list) – the board as a list of lists.

  • ships (dict) – the ships to be placed.

  • algorithm (str ("simple", "random", "custom" currently implemented.)) – the method of placement to be used.

Returns:

the updated board with ships placed.

Return type:

list

components.print_board(board: list[list[str]]) → None¶

Prints out the board to the console. Not used in the web-based game.

Parameters:

board (list) – a list of lists representing a board.

:return None

components.validate_square(square: tuple[int, int], size: int) → bool¶

Checks that a square falls within the boundaries of the board

Parameters:

  • square (tuple) – the square to be checked.

  • size (int (should be > 0)) – the size of the board.

Returns:

whether the square is valid or not

Return type:

bool

ECM1400 battleships
